author: PerryThePlatypus
title: This is Halloween , This is Halloween!
review:
This is , without a doubt , the most detailed minifigure of Disney minifigures series 2 , and also one of the most detailed figures I've ever seen. This figure just  blows my mind.

This figure is just perfect from top to bottom. The new hair mold is phenomenal! It's appropriately long for an accurate portrayal of the character , with molding of ridges all around the hair. The faces don't really capture the character's appearance in the movie in my opinion, as it would be hard to give the look of the stop motion animation feel from the movie , but with what Lego could work with, it's still really good and it doesn't bother me at all. the facial expressions include a smile and an open smile face and they both look nice. What makes this figure SO detailed is the stitching , the cloth and patches all around the legs and torso of the figure, which makes for some really accurate representation of the character. I just can't do this figure justice with words, it's just really THAT good to me. The dual-molded legs and arms (with stitches also printed on them) and the shoe printing were a really nice touch. The accessory is a dead flower, using a plant stem piece and the flower accessory piece in black, both exclusive in this coloring here. The accessory choice was pretty clever since it's from a really iconic scene from the movie , and I especially really appreciate how Lego included an extra of the stem piece and the flower top piece to have an entire second dead flower build.

Definitely one of the best of Disney minifigures series 2 (I like Jack Skellington more by a fair portion). I really just can't find a flaw in this figure. I love this figure , especially as a fan of Disney and The Nightmare Before Christmas. This is just a perfect figure and would be an outstanding addition to your minifigure collection, even if you're not a fan of Disney. I completely recommend this, totally worth the money.

author: Odeinoichus
title: She is the one with the patchwork face.
review:
Set #71024 Sally: The Nightmare Before Christmas is a phenomena these days being well-beloved and quite open for merchandise. So naturally it heads to LEGO in Disney Series 2.

Sally is one part of the main protagonists. Her Minifigure looks great, she has a plethora of intricate details for all the seams and joints interconnected via the sewing thread and needle used to put her together. Her torso and legs feature dual-moulding, possibly even triple-moulding judging by how many different colours are used. She has printed designs on her arms, a new hair piece with long wavy back that sits flush against her back and two different smiling facial expressions.

For an accessory she has two plant elements in black, one of the newer plant stem hand held items and a star-shaped flower hair pin from LEGO Friends. Combined they do an effective job of making a piece of Deadly Nightshade. Overall Sally is a very impressive Minifigure and I Highly Recommend her.
